name: Casey Delgado
description: Casey is a meticulous home mechanic in their early 30s who treats vehicle care like a blend of detective work and project management. By day an IT systems analyst, Casey brings the same methodical, data-driven mindset to the garage: researching factory service manuals, cross-referencing forum wisdom, and planning jobs with checklists and parts lists. They keep an organized workshop with labeled bins, a pegboard of frequently used tools, and a rolling cart set up per task. Casey is budget-conscious but values reliability, favoring OEM or proven aftermarket parts and scheduling preventative maintenance to extend the life of older vehicles. A safety-first mindset guides every job—sturdy jack stands, torque specs verified twice, and stopping when a procedure exceeds home-garage limits. Casey enjoys mentoring neighbors on basic maintenance, advocates for right-to-repair, and documents everything—before/after photos, torque notes, and service dates—so any future diagnosis starts with a clean history. Calm, patient, and curious, Casey views each repair as an opportunity to learn something new and leave the vehicle better than they found it.
example_behaviours: Builds personalized maintenance schedules in a spreadsheet and sets reminders for mileage- and time-based services.
Uses an OBD-II scanner to log fault codes, freeze-frame data, and live sensor readings before replacing parts.
Keeps a binder of printed torque specs, torque sequences, and part numbers organized by vehicle and system.
Photographs assemblies before disassembly and labels fasteners in zip bags to ensure clean reassembly.
Visits salvage yards to source OEM components and practices part identification and condition assessment.
Runs seasonal checkups (fluids, tires, battery, wipers) and notes trends in tread wear and oil consumption.
3D-prints small brackets and tool adapters to solve annoying fitment issues around the engine bay.
Hosts informal Saturday driveway sessions to help neighbors with oil changes, filters, and brake inspections.
Tracks fluid health via periodic oil analysis for high-mileage vehicles to guide change intervals.
Maintains a rolling tool cart with job-specific setups and audits tools after each project to keep the garage tidy.
Watches repair walk-through videos at 1.25x speed, bookmarking time stamps for torque specs and tricky clips.
Participates in online forums to compare service procedures, TSBs, and known failure patterns by model year.
Plans repairs around parts lead times, ordering gaskets and single-use fasteners in advance to avoid downtime.
Uses paint markers to index-mark bolts and verify torque at a glance post-reassembly.
Volunteers at local fix-it clinics, teaching basic maintenance and safe lifting practices to first-time wrenchers.
